      • createConnection

        public static void createConnection(java.lang.String url,
                                    java.lang.String user,
                                    java.lang.String password)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Create the database connection and maintain, use only once. ****Be sure to connect before using any method.****
        Parameters:
        url - The database url. EX: "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/databaseName"
        user - The database user. Ex: "root"
        password - The database password
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • makeConnection

        public static void makeConnection(java.lang.String url,
                                  java.lang.String user,
                                  java.lang.String password,
                                  java.lang.String driver)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Deprecated. For no mysql databases Create the database connection and maintain, use only once. ****Be sure to connect before using any method.****
        Parameters:
        url - The database url. EX: "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/databaseName"
        user - The database user. Ex: "root"
        password - The database password
        driver - The connection driver. Ex: "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • insert

        public static void insert(java.lang.String tableName,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fieldsAndValues)
                   throws InvalidTypeArgsException,
                          java.sql.SQLException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Insert into database
        Parameters:
        tableName - Table name in database. Ex: person
        fieldsAndValues - Pairs of fields and values ​​to enter, the fields must have the same name in the database table. EX: "name", "Test", "age", 18
        Throws:
        InvalidTypeArgsException
        java.sql.SQLException
        ConnectionNotFoundException

      • insert

        public static void insert(java.lang.Object object)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Insert into database the object. The attributes must have the same name, as well as the name of the class that is the name of the table.
        Parameters:
        object - The fill object to insert into database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ConnectionNotFoundException

      • insert

        public static void insert(java.lang.Object object,
                          boolean autoIncrement)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Insert into database the object. The attributes must have the same name, as well as the name of the class that is the name of the table.
        Parameters:
        object - The fill object to insert into database.
        autoIncrement - if false, insert also the primary key code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ConnectionNotFoundException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • select

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> select(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                      java.lang.String whereClause)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                      java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                      java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                                      ConnectionNotFoundException
        Selects the fields in the table that meet the condition.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of objects that will be populated with the result of the query.
        whereClause - The condition. Ex: "name LIKE J%"
        Returns:
        The list of these objects. Convert each one in turn.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

      • update

        public static void update(java.lang.Object object)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Update the object in the database, by the primary key. The attributes must have the same name, as well as the name of the class that is the name of the table.
        Parameters:
        object - The fill object to update into database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ConnectionNotFoundException

      • update

        public static void update(java.lang.Object object,
                          java.lang.String whereClause)
                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Update the object in the database, by the where clause. The attributes must have the same name, as well as the name of the class that is the name of the table.
        Parameters:
        object - The fill object to update into database.
        whereClause - The where clause to update the object. Ex: "city LIKE 'Alabama'".
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ConnectionNotFoundException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • update

        public static void update(java.lang.String tableName,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fieldsAndValues,
                          int codeId)
                   throws InvalidTypeArgsException,
                          java.sql.SQLException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Update in the database, by the primary key code.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of table.
        fieldsAndValues - Pairs of fields and values ​​to enter, the fields must have the same name in the database table. EX: "name", "Test"; "age", 18
        codeId - The primary key code.
        Throws:
        InvalidTypeArgsException
        java.sql.SQLException
        ConnectionNotFoundException

      • update

                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fieldsAndValues,
                          java.lang.String whereClause)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          InvalidTypeArgsException,
                          ConnectionNotFoundException
        Update in the database, by the where clause.
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of table.
        fieldsAndValues - Pairs of fields and values ​​to enter, the fields must have the same name in the database table. EX: "name", "Test"; "age", 18
        whereClause - The condition. Ex: "name LIKE J%"
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        InvalidTypeArgsException
        ConnectionNotFoundException

                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,

        Parameters:
        object - The fill object to delete into database.
        whereClause - The where clause to delete. Ex: "name LIKE J%"

        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of table.
        codeId - The code from primary key.
